modules.title: Orientation to Astronomy & Tools
modules.description: Introduction to astronomy, tools, and career paths.
modules.content: This module introduces the fundamentals of astronomy, its interdisciplinary connections (physics, astrobiology, engineering), and tools used in the field. Learn about units like AU and light-years, basic calculus for orbits, and Python for data analysis. Explore ethics, citizen science, and career paths in space science.

submodules.title: Introduction to Astronomy
submodules.content: Learn the definition, scope, and interdisciplinary links of astronomy, connecting physics, astrobiology, and engineering.

submodules.title: Math/Physics Primer
submodules.content: Understand units (AU, light-years, parsecs), basic calculus (derivatives for velocity, integrals for orbits), and observational math (logarithms for magnitudes).

submodules.title: Basic Data Analysis Skills
submodules.content: Introduction to Python for astronomy and interpreting citizen science datasets.

submodules.title: Ethics in Astronomy
submodules.content: Explore planetary protection, cultural heritage (e.g., Moon treaties), and risks of Mars Sample Return.

submodules.title: Modern Tools & Citizen Science
submodules.content: Use apps like Stellarium and SkySafari, explore AI sky surveys, and learn about radio telescopes like ALMA.

submodules.title: Amateur Astronomy
submodules.content: Learn DIY telescope building and backyard observation techniques.

submodules.title: Careers in Space Science
submodules.content: Discover roles like astronomer, astrobiologist, mission designer, and space lawyer.

submodules.title: Guest Lectures
submodules.content: Watch interviews with professionals, such as a NASA engineer or SETI researcher.

modules.title: Observing the Universe
modules.description: Learn to observe the night sky and use telescopes.
modules.content: Discover how to observe the night sky using celestial coordinates and telescopes. Learn about space missions like JWST and Hubble, and practice data analysis with tools like Astropy and FITS.

submodules.title: 1.1 The Night Sky
submodules.content: Learn about constellations, celestial coordinates (RA/Dec), and the impact of light pollution. Activity: Use a Celestial Events Tracker to plan observations.

submodules.title: 1.2 Observational Tools
submodules.content: Explore telescopes (radio, optical, space-based) and spectroscopy basics. Lab: Build a simple spectroscope.

submodules.title: 1.3 Space Missions Overview
submodules.content: Study JWST, Hubble, Chandra, and their contributions. Case Study: Fixing Hubble’s mirror flaw.

submodules.title: 1.4 Data Analysis Techniques
submodules.content: Learn image processing (stacking, noise reduction) and software tools like Astropy and FITS.

modules.title: The Solar System
modules.description: Explore the formation and dynamics of our solar system.
modules.content: Study the formation of the solar system, the Sun’s heliosphere, and planetary dynamics. Explore habitability on Mars, Europa, and Enceladus, and learn about missions like OSIRIS-REx and DART.

submodules.title: 2.1 Formation & Dynamics
submodules.content: Understand the nebular hypothesis, planetary migration, and the Nice Model.

submodules.title: 2.2 Sun & Heliosphere
submodules.content: Learn about solar wind, space weather, and discoveries from the Parker Solar Probe.

submodules.title: 2.3 Planets & Moons
submodules.content: Study comparative planetology (Venus vs. Earth vs. Titan) and recent missions like Perseverance, JUICE, and Dragonfly.

submodules.title: 2.4 Small Bodies
submodules.content: Explore OSIRIS-REx sample return, DART asteroid deflection, and the Kuiper Belt and Oort Cloud.

submodules.title: 2.5 Habitability
submodules.content: Investigate Mars subsurface lakes, Europa’s ocean, and Enceladus plumes.

modules.title: Stars & Stellar Evolution
modules.content: Understand stellar physics, the H-R diagram, and the lifecycle of stars from protostars to supernovae. Explore exotic phenomena like hypernovae and use Gaia data to map star clusters.

submodules.title: 3.1 Stellar Physics
submodules.content: Learn about the H-R diagram, nuclear fusion, Chandrasekhar limit, and stellar nucleosynthesis (s-process, r-process).

submodules.title: 3.2 Star Lifecycle
submodules.content: Study protostars, red giants, supernovae, compact objects (neutron stars, magnetars), and stellar populations (I, II, III).

submodules.title: 3.3 Exotic Phenomena
submodules.content: Explore hypernovae, kilonovas, and Tidal Disruption Events.

submodules.title: 3.4 Star Mapping
submodules.content: Use Gaia Mission data for 3D Milky Way mapping. Activity: Analyze star clusters with AstroVision.

modules.title: Galaxies & Large-Scale Structure
modules.description: Study galaxies and the cosmic web.
modules.content: Learn about the Milky Way, galaxy types, and the cosmic web. Study active galactic nuclei, quasars, and the future Milky Way-Andromeda merger.

submodules.title: 4.1 Milky Way & Galactic Archeology
submodules.content: Study Gaia data, Sagittarius A*, dark matter halo, and the interstellar medium (ISM).

submodules.title: 4.2 Galaxy Types & Evolution
submodules.content: Learn about JWST’s high-redshift galaxies and ultra-diffuse galaxies.

submodules.title: 4.3 Active Galactic Nuclei
submodules.content: Explore quasars, blazars, and supermassive black hole mergers.

submodules.title: 4.4 Cosmic Web
submodules.content: Study filaments, voids, dark matter’s role (simulations), and galaxy clusters and superclusters.

submodules.title: 4.5 Galactic Collisions
submodules.content: Learn about the Milky Way-Andromeda merger and tidal streams.

modules.title: Cosmology
modules.description: Explore the origins and fate of the universe.
modules.content: Explore the Big Bang, cosmic microwave background, and dark matter. Learn about observational cosmology and theories like the Big Rip and multiverse.

submodules.title: 5.1 Big Bang & Early Universe
submodules.content: Study the CMB, inflation, and baryon acoustic oscillations. Learn JWST’s role in challenging galaxy formation timelines.

submodules.title: 5.2 Dark Universe
submodules.content: Explore dark matter candidates (WIMPs, axions) and dark energy experiments (DESI, Euclid).

submodules.title: 5.3 Observational Cosmology
submodules.content: Learn about Type Ia supernovae, BAO, and gravitational lensing.

submodules.title: 5.4 Fate of the Universe
submodules.content: Explore heat death, Big Rip, and cyclic models.

submodules.title: 5.5 Quantum Cosmology
submodules.content: Dive into advanced topics like string theory, the holographic principle, and the multiverse.

modules.title: Exoplanets & Astrobiology
modules.description: Discover exoplanets and the search for life.
modules.content: Discover exoplanet detection methods and biosignatures. Explore the Fermi Paradox, technosignatures, and future missions like ARIEL and LIFE.

submodules.title: 6.1 Exoplanet Detection
submodules.content: Learn JWST’s role, direct imaging, AI in data analysis, and methods like radial velocity, transit, and microlensing.

submodules.title: 6.2 Habitability
submodules.content: Study biosignatures (O₂, CH₄) and false positives (e.g., Venusian phosphine).

submodules.title: 6.3 Life Beyond Earth
submodules.content: Explore extremophiles, origin of life theories, and the Fermi Paradox.

submodules.title: 6.4 Technosignatures & Megastructures
submodules.content: Learn about Dyson spheres, FRBs, and Tabby’s Star.

submodules.title: 6.5 Future Missions
submodules.content: Explore the Habitable Worlds Observatory, ARIEL, and LIFE Space Mission.

modules.title: Theoretical Astrophysics
modules.description: Dive into relativity, gravitational waves, and more.
modules.content: Dive into relativity, gravitational waves, and astrochemistry. Simulate galaxy mergers and study magnetohydrodynamics in solar flares and accretion disks.

submodules.title: 7.1 Relativity & Gravitational Waves
submodules.content: Study LIGO/Virgo detections and multi-messenger astronomy. Activity: Simulate gravitational waves (Python lab).

submodules.title: 7.2 High-Energy Astrophysics
submodules.content: Explore gamma-ray bursts and pulsar wind nebulae.

submodules.title: 7.3 Astrochemistry
submodules.content: Learn about prebiotic molecules in nebulae (e.g., glycine in comets).

submodules.title: 7.4 Computational Astrophysics
submodules.content: Simulate galaxy mergers using Python/Julia labs.

submodules.title: 7.5 Magnetohydrodynamics & Plasma Physics
submodules.content: Study MHD basics and applications in solar flares and accretion disks.

modules.title: Space Technology & Exploration
modules.description: Learn about rockets, missions, and space policy.
modules.content: Learn about reusable rockets, mission design, and space law. Explore Artemis, Mars colonization, and ethical debates on space sustainability.

submodules.title: 8A.1 Rockets & Propulsion
submodules.content: Learn about reusable rockets (Starship) and nuclear thermal propulsion.

submodules.title: 8A.2 Mission Design
submodules.content: Explore Artemis, Mars Sample Return, and Lunar Gateway.

submodules.title: 8A.3 Satellite Technology & Space Telescopes
submodules.content: Study Hubble, JWST, and design considerations.

submodules.title: 8A.4a Interstellar Travel
submodules.content: Learn about light sails and Breakthrough Starshot.

submodules.title: 8A.4b Space Sustainability
submodules.content: Explore debris mitigation and the ClearSpace-1 mission.

submodules.title: 8B.1 Space Missions
submodules.content: Study historical (Apollo, Voyager), current (ISS, Artemis), and future (Mars colonization) missions, including international cooperation.

submodules.title: 8B.2 Space Law & Ethics
submodules.content: Learn about Artemis Accords, asteroid mining laws, and terraforming ethics.

submodules.title: 8B.3 Ethical Debates
submodules.content: Debate prioritizing space exploration during climate crises.

submodules.title: 8B.4 Space Sustainability
submodules.content: Study Kessler syndrome and debris mitigation strategies.

modules.title: Cutting-Edge Topics
modules.description: Explore neutrinos, AI, and multi-messenger astronomy.
modules.content: Explore neutrino astronomy, AI in galaxy classification, and multi-messenger astronomy. Conduct virtual labs on Martian soil and quantum sensors.

submodules.title: 9.1 Neutrino Astronomy
submodules.content: Learn about neutrino properties, IceCube detections, and supernova neutrinos.

submodules.title: 9.2 AI in Astronomy
submodules.content: Explore neural networks for galaxy classification and AI-driven research.

submodules.title: 9.3 Astrobiology Labs
submodules.content: Conduct virtual experiments on Martian soil and Europa ocean chemistry.

submodules.title: 9.4 Quantum Technologies
submodules.content: Learn about quantum sensors for dark matter detection.

submodules.title: 9.5 Multi-Messenger Astronomy
submodules.content: Study GW170817 and synergies across observational windows.
